     1→# Setup UNIX development environments
     2→
     3→Please make sure the following tools are setup properly
     4→
     5→- Oh-my-zsh + Nerd Fonts
     6→  - `sudo apt install zsh` (if zsh not exist)
     7→  - `sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)"`
     8→- git (zsh git plugins)+ LazyGit
     9→- NeoVim + LazyVim (sync plugins)
    10→- fzf + setup zsh autocompletion (`zsh-autosuggestions`, `zsh-syntax-highlighting` plugins)
    11→  - `cd ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins`
    12→  - `git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions.git`
    13→  - `git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git`

    15→  - `curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh`, `sudo sh get-docker.sh`: <https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/>
    16→  - <https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/linux-postinstall/#manage-docker-as-a-non-root-user>
    17→- Install Pueue <https://github.com/Nukesor/pueue> and make sure the pueued is setup
    18→
    19→## MacOS
    20→
    21→> use launchd replace systemd
    22→
    23→Setup Homebrew
    24→
    25→---
    26→
    27→Tmux
    28→
    29→<https://github.com/tmux-plugins/tpm>
    30→
    31→```bash
    32→git clone https://github.com/tmux-plugins/tpm ~/.tmux/plugins/tpm
    33→```
    34→
    35→`~/.tmux.conf`
    36→
    37→```conf
    38→# List of plugins
    39→set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tpm'
    40→set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-sensible'
    41→
    42→# Other examples:
    43→# set -g @plugin 'github_username/plugin_name'
    44→# set -g @plugin 'github_username/plugin_name#branch'
    45→# set -g @plugin 'git@github.com:user/plugin'
    46→# set -g @plugin 'git@bitbucket.com:user/plugin'
    47→
    48→# Initialize TMUX plugin manager (keep this line at the very bottom of tmux.conf)
    49→run '~/.tmux/plugins/tpm/tpm'
    50→```
    51→
    52→```bash
    53→# type this in terminal if tmux is already running
    54→tmux source ~/.tmux.conf
    55→```

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101 2026-01-23T02:32:53.865Z)**_

<tool-use data-tool-type="write" data-tool-name="Write"><details>
<summary>Tool use: **Write**</summary>

```md
# UNIX Development Environment Setup

Make sure the following tools are properly installed and configured. Detect the current OS (Ubuntu/Debian or MacOS) and use the appropriate installation method.

On MacOS, install Homebrew first if not already present, then prefer `brew install` for most tools.

## Package Manager (MacOS)

- Homebrew: `/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"`

## Shell: Zsh + Oh-My-Zsh

- Install zsh if not present
  - Ubuntu: `sudo apt install zsh`
  - MacOS: pre-installed
- Set zsh as default shell: `chsh -s $(which zsh)`
- Install Oh-My-Zsh: `sh -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ohmyzsh/ohmyzsh/master/tools/install.sh)"`
- Install plugins:
  - `git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestions.git ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/zsh-autosuggestions`
  - `git clone https://github.com/zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlighting.git ~/.oh-my-zsh/custom/plugins/zsh-syntax-highlighting`
- Configure `~/.zshrc` plugins: `plugins=(git zsh-autosuggestions zsh-syntax-highlighting fzf)`

## Nerd Fonts

Required for terminal icons in LazyVim, Powerlevel10k, etc.

- MacOS: `brew install --cask font-jetbrains-mono-nerd-font` (or another Nerd Font of choice)
- Ubuntu: download from <https://github.com/ryanoasis/nerd-fonts/releases> and install to `~/.local/share/fonts/`, then run `fc-cache -fv`
- Configure your terminal emulator to use the installed Nerd Font

## Git + LazyGit

- git
  - Ubuntu: `sudo apt install git`
  - MacOS: `brew install git`
- LazyGit: <https://github.com/jesseduffield/lazygit>
  - Ubuntu: download binary from GitHub releases or use the official PPA
  - MacOS: `brew install lazygit`

## fzf (Fuzzy Finder)

- Ubuntu: `sudo apt install fzf` or install from git: `git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/junegunn/fzf.git ~/.fzf && ~/.fzf/install`
- MacOS: `brew install fzf && $(brew --prefix)/opt/fzf/install`

## NeoVim + LazyVim

- NeoVim: <https://github.com/neovim/neovim>
  - Ubuntu: download the latest stable appimage or build from source (the apt version is often outdated)
  - MacOS: `brew install neovim`
- LazyVim: <https://www.lazyvim.org/installation>
  - Back up existing config: `mv ~/.config/nvim ~/.config/nvim.bak`
  - Clone starter: `git clone https://github.com/LazyVim/starter ~/.config/nvim && rm -rf ~/.config/nvim/.git`
  - Launch `nvim` to sync plugins

## Tmux + TPM

- Install tmux
  - Ubuntu: `sudo apt install tmux`
  - MacOS: `brew install tmux`
- Install TPM (Tmux Plugin Manager): `git clone https://github.com/tmux-plugins/tpm ~/.tmux/plugins/tpm`
- Create/update `~/.tmux.conf`:

\```conf
setw -g mouse on
setw -g mode-keys vi

# List of plugins
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tpm'
set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-sensible'

# Initialize TMUX plugin manager (keep this line at the very bottom of tmux.conf)
run '~/.tmux/plugins/tpm/tpm'
\```

- Reload config if tmux is running: `tmux source ~/.tmux.conf`
- Install plugins: press `prefix + I` inside tmux

## Docker

- Ubuntu:
  - `curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh && sudo sh get-docker.sh`
  - Add user to docker group (rootless): `sudo usermod -aG docker $USER && newgrp docker`
  - Reference: <https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/>
- MacOS: `brew install --cask docker` (Docker Desktop) or `brew install docker` (CLI only)

## Pueue (Task Queue Manager)

<https://github.com/Nukesor/pueue>

- Ubuntu: download binary from GitHub releases or `cargo install pueue`
- MacOS: `brew install pueue`
- Start the daemon: `pueued -d`
- To auto-start on boot:
  - Ubuntu (systemd): `systemctl --user enable --now pueued`
  - MacOS (launchd): `brew services start pueue`

```
```

    43→- MacOS: `brew install fzf && $(brew --prefix)/opt/fzf/install`

    48→  - Ubuntu: download the latest stable appimage or build from source (the apt version is often outdated)
    49→  - MacOS: `brew install neovim`

    51→  - Back up existing config: `mv ~/.config/nvim ~/.config/nvim.bak`
    52→  - Clone starter: `git clone https://github.com/LazyVim/starter ~/.config/nvim && rm -rf ~/.config/nvim/.git`

    61→- Create/update `~/.tmux.conf`:
    62→
    63→```conf
    64→setw -g mouse on
    65→setw -g mode-keys vi
    66→
    67→# List of plugins
    68→set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tpm'
    69→set -g @plugin 'tmux-plugins/tmux-sensible'
    70→
    71→# Initialize TMUX plugin manager (keep this line at the very bottom of tmux.conf)
    72→run '~/.tmux/plugins/tpm/tpm'
    73→```
    74→
    75→- Reload config if tmux is running: `tmux source ~/.tmux.conf`
    76→- Install plugins: press `prefix + I` inside tmux
    77→
    78→## Docker
    79→
    80→- Ubuntu:
    81→  - `curl -fsSL https://get.docker.com -o get-docker.sh && sudo sh get-docker.sh`
    82→  - Add user to docker group (rootless): `sudo usermod -aG docker $USER && newgrp docker`
    83→  - Reference: <https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/>
    84→- MacOS: `brew install --cask docker` (Docker Desktop) or `brew install docker` (CLI only)
    85→
    86→## Pueue (Task Queue Manager)
    87→
    88→<https://github.com/Nukesor/pueue>
    89→
    90→- Ubuntu: download binary from GitHub releases or `cargo install pueue`
    91→- MacOS: `brew install pueue`
    92→- Start the daemon: `pueued -d`
    93→- To auto-start on boot:
    94→  - Ubuntu (systemd): `systemctl --user enable --now pueued`
    95→  - MacOS (launchd): `brew services start pueue`
    96→

_**Agent (claude-opus-4-5-20251101 2026-01-23T02:35:01.675Z)**_

Here's what I changed:

1. **Added a preamble** instructing the agent to detect the OS and use the appropriate method, with Homebrew preferred on MacOS.

2. **Moved Homebrew to the top** as a prerequisite for MacOS.

3. **Restructured into clear sections** — each tool gets its own `##` heading with Ubuntu and MacOS instructions side by side.

4. **Filled in missing installation commands**:
   - Nerd Fonts (brew cask on MacOS, manual install on Ubuntu)
   - LazyGit (`brew install lazygit`, PPA for Ubuntu)
   - fzf (both apt and git-based install)
   - NeoVim (appimage for Ubuntu, brew for MacOS)
   - LazyVim (backup + clone starter)
   - Pueue (brew / cargo / binary)

5. **Made Tmux a general section** instead of MacOS-only, with the config inlined and plugin install instructions.

6. **Added daemon auto-start instructions** for Pueue (systemd on Ubuntu, launchd/brew services on MacOS).

7. **Added `.zshrc` plugin line** so it's clear what to put in the config.
